text_final: This is one of the absolute best party game ever. I bought A2A at a local game shop on a whim year ago. My Amazon purchase wa the big set for a friend and his family. Be prepared for hour of fun. Here is the general idea: First, get a group of people wanting some social fun Second, pas our the Noun card (they aren't called that, but that's what they are) Third, start with someone called the "jusdge" who pick up an adjective card (again, not what they are called, but it's what they are) Fourth, the judge toss the card into the center and other player pick a noun that embodies the card the judge tossed out. The person who is the round's "judge" toss out a card that is a descriptor. Let's say that the word is "Hot." Other player look through their collection of card to find a word that embodies "hot." One player might toss in "Marylin Monrow" and another might toss in "The Sun." Which will the judge choose? Maybe your comment might influece the outcome. Go wild! This is a game learned by new player in le than a minute. If it's not on your game shelf, it should be. Note: we play with a local rule that's similar to musical chairs: The judge reject the last entry on the table. This encourages fast play. If all player play a card quickly, the judge ha the option to accept all entries.

text_final: Jeanette MacDonald shine like a bright Northern star in this 1933 MGM classic also starring Ramon Novarro. Novarro wa a matinee idol at MGM during the silent era; in 1922, after filming "The Prisoner of Zenda," MGM executive brought him into their studio a the Latin lover after the sudden and unexpected demise of Rudolph Valentino. Novarro had only two year in his contact with MGM when he did "The Cat and the Fiddle." Novarro offer a brilliant performance a Victor Florescu, a talented, Brussels-based composer of serious music under the tutelage of respected Professor Bertier. When he meet beautiful Shirley Sheridan (MacDonald), a New Yorker living in Brussels a a professional Opera singer, the two bohemian fall in love. The story is a musical comedy and the song from the Kern-Harbaugh stage musical comedy is used largely intact. Jeanette MacDonald's "The Night Was Made for Love" later became a big hit. This pre-code film is not without controversy with regard to the moral codes, since MacDonald and Navarro are portrayed a live-in companions. Many movie critic and fan were used to Novarro in silent movie and they were le enthusiastic about his talkie movies. In fact some of the greatest silent star of MGM had difficulty making success when talkie came along. I for one enjoyed this romantic comedy tremendously. I thought MacDonald and Novarro made lovely couple and the story is full of warmth.

text_final: Schleich's North America Giant Volcano with T-Rex Playset is a beautiful piece of art and very instructional toy. It's immaculately detailed and texture are exquisite, especially on the dino's. There are so many detail to point out and explain to your little one a you play together and I'm surprised by how much my little 5 year old loved this set. The bone were especially cool to see. That said, Schleich's Giant Volcano Playset is a vinyl monstrosity that is a chore to put together very cumbersome to store anywhere. The material is soft vinyl and just weighs a ton. It came in 5 or 6 piece and held together by these tiny brittle peg that wa an utter nightmare to assemble. Just a very poor design choice of material. Definitely bad if your little one is prone to throw thing - each of the piece from this set is hefty and will cause some damage. many of the highlighted feature don't work too well or wa embarrassingly underwhelming - ie: the "exploding wall" the wall piece had to be assembled into the nook and pressing the button push the piece over - kind of. The flaw here is that the piece are so heavy, the notch of plastic that knock over the wall can barely budge the piece and they pretty much just slide down. The tree snap just hasn't worked yet. The root don't stay agape and the spring snap doesn't really do much. About the only thing that doe work is the Dino jail gate and even that contraption seems over engineered. Flaws aside, the set is very beautiful but alarmingly over priced at almost a hundred dollars. Ouch! I get it - it's vinyl and hefty and very detailed - almost like a model kit but $100 is just too much for such badly engineered play. However, it is great if you're a Schleich fan.

text_final: These are great patch they wipe well and pretty much fit any caliber. I use them on my AR. However... DO NOT pinch too much fabric into the ring a it WILL get stuck in your barrel. This happened to me (twice ) I embarrassingly admit. First timer I took to a gun smith and he poked it out with a rifle rod. The 2nd I just stepped on the otis cord and PULLED my heart out. They say you can use each cloth 6 time but if you have a dirty barrel it's more like 3-4... the insert get opened up and lose integrity and it make it easy for the patch to break and again... get stuck (happened a well) but I used a rifle rod to push it out. I've since become a master of these patch and have used over 65.... meaning I've done about 3 time the swipe or like 200 swipe through my rifles. I recommend the smaller 2 inch patch a they are le likely to get stuck but these are still great. I always pinch close to the insert and never use a flimsy patch. I always give it a nice tug to make sure it won't fall off. I also always check how big it clump up at the base. It should feel like a tiny pebble or whatever. Mind you the bullet that go through the barrel ha a small diameter.

text_final: I started looking for climbing toy for our now 17mth old before Christmas & after hour online, this wa my fav. I planned to buy it for our daughter big Santa gift but hesitated after reading some review about poor safety features...when the priced dropped after Christmas, I'd still not found anything I liked better so I decided to give it a shot. I am SO glad I ignored the few negative reviews. It is absolutely perfect for our energetic, climbing toddler. She is able to climb the wall with no trouble, the slide is fast & long enough for her to enjoy, she can get a ball into the basketball hoop herself & while the potential is there with most any toy for a child to use it incorrectly and possibly get hurt, under minimal supervision, I see no imminent risk in this toy. (the concern I read were toddler "diving" through the hole for football to be thrown through). That particular opening in question doe not hit our child in a place height wise where that is an issue. If she's standing, the hole is around her belly, if she sits, she can peek through the hole, but with the majority of her body safely on the platform, she isn't likely to fall from it. A child, if intentionally trying to dive through, coud get it through it I guess but it doesnt seem very probable. Again, I'm glad I bypassed that info and ordered anyway. I wa also glad it wa not quite a huge a I'd envisioned, it will be easy to move outside in warmer weather. It wa also easy to put together which is a major plus! As a child development professional, I'd also recommend this for building gross motor skills. Definitely recommend this toy, we are so pleased with it...most importantly, so is our child! Alas, she ha something she is allowed to climb on & it satisfies that natural interest for her, safely!

text_final: This is a good alternative if you don't want to drill into your bathroom tile or spend too much money on an all metal kit. Just keep in mind that this kit utilizes plastic mounting hardware and significant effort is needed to adjust the height of the shower head holder with just your thumb - the holder is spring loaded and us a very heavy duty spring (its the most durable part of the whole kit). I wouldnt recommend this item to anyone with arthritis! I promptly returned this kit and purchased an independent shower head holder that used a high quality suction cup. With my disabilities, I needed to be able to maintain the shower head at a fixed position, just at a lower height. Still, if you're in need of an affordable solution to an adjustable height shower head holder, this might be for you. However, if you have arthritis, you may want to keep shopping.

label: OR
text_final: My dog are fairly rough on toy - very few last for more than a week, and many die within a day or two. Obviously I am not alone in this: anyone reading this review is likely looking for a solid, durable toy which will survive the rough play of a chewer or large breed dog (or both). This ball is not solid, and it is not durable. The ball look exactly like the 4.5" model of a "Soft & Tough Clutch" ball I purchased last year. The cyan colored 6" Soft & Tough Clutch that I purchased is easily my dogs' favorite toy, and ha survived for many month now (I think I bought it in November) with nary a scratch. I decided to purchase a second ball because they loved it so much, and I went for the 4.5" grape ball the next time around. I took it out of the package and I could immediately feel the difference in the texture. I can't quite explain it, but the Soft & Tough feel exactly how it name describes it. This ball felt soft and rubbery, like the cheap $3-$5 Walmart toy I used to buy before I realized that they only lasted 10 minutes. The difference: this ball didn't even make it 10 minutes. In le than 3 minutes, my dog had begun taking chunk off of the ball and it had to go to the trash can. Put another way: prorated out, I wa paying about $180/hour for this dog toy!!! Bottom line: I am not sure if I got an imitation/knock-off, or if the ball are made by different companies. They look the same and are advertised the same on Amazon, but there wa a clear and discernible difference in texture between the two balls, and that translated into the difference between a long-time favorite toy, and a 3-minute pile of garbage. So buyer beware: the "Soft & Clutch" line earns 5 star and then some, while the Soft-Flex ball is solidly in the "don't waste your money on this" category.

label: OR
text_final: Due to the quirk of the marketplace, this wa available at a much lower price than the 6" and 8" wrench in the same series. The one I received wa remarkable in that the jaw were very, very close to parallel. Most wrench of this type, whether foreign or domestic, tend to have jaw that are closer together at the opening tip than deep towards the throat, thus requiring the user to lift up the wrench axially after each turn for repositioning, rather than pulling the wrench radially away from the nut. If there is no room for this, then the jaw need to be loosened to remove the wrench, and retightened in the new position. Parallel jaws, or jaw that are wider at the mouth than throat, save the extra steps. The post that hold the worm gear adjuster wa only lightly staked, and unscrews to allow maintenance. Due to manufacturing tolerances, however, there is no assurance that yours won't be impossible to unscrew, or that the jaw will be parallel.

text_final: I am a special educator and purchased this product to begin teaching one of my student to complete jigsaw puzzles. Most jigsaw puzzle on the market contain at least eight piece whereas this set includes four different four-piece jigsaw puzzles. The limited number of piece make this product a perfect tool for introducing jigsaw puzzles! I will continue to use this product in the future, both for my student and my own child. I have removed one star for two reasons: 1. The illustration on the puzzle leave a bit to be desired. I think that brighter image would be more interesting and motivating for young learners. 2. All four puzzle are within one board (with a frame around each). I have found that this is distracting and confusing for some children. I think this set could be improved by separating the puzzle onto individual boards. One more note: This may be considered a pro or con, depending on how you intend to use the product. The outline of each puzzle piece is drawn onto the wooden frame beneath it. This may serve a a helpful prompt for some children, a they can match the shape of the pieces. However, if you are a teacher or therapist who is measuring independence, this feature may be problematic for you. Overall, I think this is a useful product and would purchase again.

text_final: The Book of Illusions--being the story of the narrator's encounter with Hector Mann, a former silent filmmaker--presents quite a few passage where the narrator describes one of Mann's films. As I wa reading Auster's novel, I kept thinking I ought not to like the book so much. After all, describing Mann's work seems patently second-hand--"telling" in creative writing workshop language--and all the narrative commentary effectively take interpretation out of readers' hands. Yet, I could not put the book down. The forthright prose and the resulting sincerity of the narrator won me over. I didn't mind his being my eye and ears. Auster's movie seemed real. While I didn't find myself watching the movie with him, he did make me want to watch them. Narrators you care about can overcome any skepticism.

text_final: This kit solved my problem of wireless doorbell range issue where you cannot place those wireless kit doorbell button outside on your metal framed front door. Metal door or door frame block out most of the wireless RF energy radiated from the remote door bell button so many folk complain that the range sucks. With this kit, you can wire in the transmitter inside your house by your original wired doorbell which will trigger the wireless doorbell when someone press your old wired doorbell button. Since the wireless transmitter is now inside your house, you get much better transmit range and you can place your remote wireless doorbell much further away upstairs and it will still be triggered. So this is a good useful solution kit to get.

In the second book, Jo Marie continues putting the final touch on the Inn with help from a handyman who doesn't like to talk about himself much. Although she find him incorrigible at times, they seem to enjoy each other's company. A friendship appears to be in bloom at Rose Harbor Inn.

label: OR
text_final: This lap loom is a nice starting point (and perhaps "enough" for those who don't wish to upsize) for child and adult who want to learn how to weave. Unlike some other product on the market for weaving, it's made by a loom company and yield a "genuine" woven product. The basic premise is to repeatedly go over and under vertical warp thread with a shed stick. One shed stick can stay in the loom at all time (until nearing the end), but on every other pas through, this weaving process must be repeated. Once the shed stick is pulled onto it long edge, every other string rise up, and yarn loaded onto a stick shuttle is passed through, and the stick shuttle lowered. This yarn is beaten down, and the process is repeated. Although the loom ha it limitation due to it small size, project that can be made from such a small loom include a placemat, small doll blanket, pillow, wall-hanging, and purse. Users can also, of course, seam together more than one project to create larger piece of fabric. The set come with one project to work on, and the included instruction booklet give suggestion about what it can be turned into. The included sample project teach how to do horizontal and vertical stripes. (I never realized how easy vertical stripe would be--you just do every other row with two different colors, and they "magically" form!) Two extra part are "missing" from this set. Although you can use it a is, you may also wish to get: (1) Wonder Wand (by the same company), which help speed up the process by pushing down every other warp thread. (2) Tapestry beater for pushing down the yarn. Otherwise, they recommend using a fork. The loom and accessory are unfinished wood. I ended up staining and varnishing them to help seal the wood and keep it looking nice, but this isn't really necessary. One extra suggestion: I find this easiest to work on with leg crossed. Otherwise, it's a bit large to be considered a "lap loom.

I also noticed the handling seemed much more stable at all speed and I could hold plane 5 mph slower than I could before. The trim seemed easier / smoother to adjust while getting on plane and the top end speed wasn't effected at all. text_final: I am a big fan of the underrated, marvellously talented late Robert Lancing, so I collect his stuff. And he did some wonderful B flick that are B Movie Addicts delight. My favourite 4D man is one of the best, but this one is not too shabby. Joan Collins is head of a group pushing an island paradise resort - yet to be built - and Lancing is the pilot of the boat that brings in the latest boatload of suckers....I mean investors...to view the imaginary golf course and club house. Only problem, refugee from THEM! are lurking in the wood making off with islander and soon to investor of Joan's resort. The effect are typical Drive-in B movie quality (but hey, I miss the old drive-ins!! When I visited Kentucky they would have dusk to dawn creature feature and that is where I first saw this movie), but Lancing a always is better than the material he is given and make this worth the ticket. So stack up four of five our your best Vincent Price and Chris Lee films, add Empire of the Ants (and watch the wonderful and well missed Robert Lancing), pop a bowl of popcorn , turn out the light and imagine you are in a car with a speaker hanging from the window. Have your own dusk to dawn creature features. Off to see if I can hunt up a copy of 4D man in DVD.....

label: OR
text_final: Psychologist Daniel Hughes ha done it again with his newest book, Attachment-Focused Parenting. In his highly-skilled and talented manner, Hughes ha managed to take the complex term and concept of attachment theory and make it accessible for the reader. Hughes help u to better appreciate that the parent-child relationship is a two-way interaction, with each being greatly influenced and affected by the other. Of equal importance, he help the reader to see that parenting go way beyond guidance and discipline; rather, both parent and child require a context for understanding what happens between them, and each is influenced by their own history. Hughes relies extensively upon example and real-life scenario a he make his points. In doing so, he appeal to a wide spectrum of parents. That is, he cite the example of a four-year-old who scream with frustration, while later addressing the parent-child struggle of a 16-year-old. Independent of age, however, the concept Hughes lay out are universal for all children, regardless of age. Get ready, though, a Hughes reminds u that the parent's own attachment history greatly affect the parent-child relationship. This certainly isn't new, a how often have we caught ourselves saying, "I never thought I would say/do what my father/mother did..." Without writing a self-help book for parents, Hughes proposes some question and concept parent should ask themselves about their own history, given the part it play in raising their kids. As a child psychologist who primarily work with foster and adopted child and their families, I continually deal with kid who have their own attachment issue to work through. While a professional can assist a child in this regard, much of the work to be done center on the child's relationship with her parent, be it foster, adoptive, or birth. Because of this, Hughes' book will be at the top of my reference list for the parent I work with, but also for other professionals.

I fell in love with the Cake Girl (Victoria, played by Ashley Williams) and wa sad to see her go (it's probably why I'm not a huge fan of Robin). This show ha continuity and a compelling storyline; it simply amazes me. It's very quotable. I find myself quoting with friend I've talked into watching it (who get equally hooked). The cast is brilliant, a well a the director and writers. Bloc Party's song: `This Modern Love' at the close of Season One clenched it for me though, dramatically building up a powerful finale I won't soon forget. It join the hall of fame for greatest season finale song with the like of The O.C's: Imogen Heap `Hide and Seek' and Grey's Anatomy's: Snow Patrol `Chasing Cars'. Hands down, this is the best sitcom I've ever seen. Buy it, watch it, love it. DISCLAIMER: Though the writer are good at what they do, don't listen to any of their commentaries. text_final: I've had this Lunchbots for over a year now. Overall, it's been a decent container, though only useful for dry goods. My original intent wa to purchase an 'heirloom' lunchbox that wa completely foodsafe -- what better choice for that than stainless steel, right? So anyway, over a year later, the paint regularly chip off. Each day, there are some paint flake to be found everyhwere -- in the tote bag I use to carry this container, on the rim, and if I'm not careful, in my food. Given the time we live in, and that there's no way for me to know for certain whether there's lead, cadmium, or other toxics in the paint, this will soon go into the trash. In fact, that's why I'm on Amazon today -- I came shopping for a 100% stainless steel replacement. After seeing this pop up in the search, I thought I'd at least help others by sharing my experience. Someone did suggest that Lunchbots wa extremely customer-service oriented, and would replace the lid -- no question asked. That wa not my experience at all. I wrote to customer service, and got a standard 'stock' response back which suggested the product is no longer under warranty and this wa considered normal 'wear and tear' -- but that I could buy some replacement lid (which were also painted) if I wanted to, at my expense. (apparently this come with a one year warranty, so that's all the product is guaranteed for) So much for quality and so much for manufacturer product support. Seriously -- what's the point of spending some $20 for a stainless steel item if it won't last much longer than a year? Best & Respectfully--

text_final: Having read and thoroughly enjoying Bernstein's earlier biography of Thomas Jefferson, I decided to give THOMAS JEFFERSON: THE REVOLUTION OF IDEAS, a look. Like his earlier work, this is a wonderful introduction to Jefferson, however this book is geared towards the school age reader. Much of the text is identical to the earlier biography. The most significant difference is the addition of dozen of illustrations, from portrait of Jefferson's friends, family, and foes, and political cartoons. My single knock on Bernstein's book is the same knock I had on his previous work. Bernstein adamantly portrays Jefferson a a "strict separationist", which in and of itself is accurate. However he fails to recognize that what constituted a "strict separationist" 200 year ago is much different than the definition given in today's climate of political correctness gone awry. Bernstein seems genuinely perplexed that Jefferson "sent Christian missionary to establish school in western territory to educate Native Americans - and convert them to Christianity. " As with extremist today, Bernstein fails to understand that Jefferson's action did not violate the First Amendment in that "Congress made no law respecting the establishment of religion. " I could spend all day writing about how mixed up people are about what the First Amendment mean and how it wa intended by our framers, but that stray from the subject at hand. All in all, this is a great introduction for school child and should capture their interest and perhaps, lead them into more indepth study of one of our greatest leaders. Monty Rainey [.

I will probably use it next to strip the paint off the cabinet in the old house and then make new doors. I can see where a home owner buying an older house could really save alot of money buying this new tool. I build high end custom furniture so i really nit pick my tool not only in there upkeep but in their performance a well and i don't keep any tool that doesnt perform. This new Porter Cable doe perform very well and I feel that if your need is for a tool like this the Porter Cable stripper is the only way to go. No more messy & expensive chemical strippers.

After I installed the sink with strainer stopper down would not hold water, A full sink would leak out in an hour. Problem easy to solve! The strainer ha a slight tolerance defect that is easy to fix. The bottom of the strainer is slight bowed up holding the stopper too slightly too high so the water leak out. Put the strainer on top of the open jaw of a vice and center a socket over the stopper handle at the center of the strainer then hitting it downward. This cause the strainer bottom to now bow down a bit. This allows the O-ring to seat properly, problem solve. Yea water stayed in the sink all night. You will need to replace the O-Ring each year or worse case every 6 month. Bottom line I love this product.

text_final: Despite having the entire Divergent series ruined by the utter mind-rape that wa Allegiant, which wa in my opinion just a 526-page plot hole of nonsense, I decided to read the Four collection -- mainly because the e-book wa available for free at my library and the other book I wanted to read weren't ready yet and I had time to kill. My conclusion after reading all of the short story is. meh. Roth seems more capable of writing a boy who doesn't sound like a teenage girl when she isn't trying to write the girl character at the same time - I'm looking at you, Allegiant - but the writing style is still not all that different. As for the story themselves, knowing the truth behind everything a revealed in Allegiant made it hard to care about anything or take any of it seriously, so I wa forced to make a very conscious effort to block that book out of my mind (moreso than I already have) in order to just accept these story for what they were in the "original" Divergent universe. And the story were just okay. While we do learn some new detail about Tobias's early Dauntless life and answer some unanswered questions, not much of it is all that interesting, and the last short story, which cover a good half of the plot from Divergent, is basically just fan fiction. All in all it wa just. okay. Altogether the collection wa a three-star read. There wa nothing particularly offensive about it, but nothing all that interesting, either. If you must read it, borrow it from a friend or get it at the library. It's really not worth taking up permanent residence on your bookshelf or Kindle library. (Oh, and if you're going to buy it in e-book format, buy them separately. Amazon seems to be taking advantage of the fact that some people may not be observant/bright enough to notice that it's actually more expensive when you buy the bundle than if you just bought them for $1. 99 each.

In this movie, there's a wide range or aspect that are keep the viewer keenly watching the unrolling of the movie, such that time pass quite quickly, and we get a glimpse of a microcosm, surrounding the customer of a small 7-11 style store in a major city. William Hurt, play a character that seems quite his own, and natural, a doe Harvey Keitel who reprises the tough-guy with a big heart role. The movie is not a chick-flick like many other movies, such a Ashley Judd's SOMEONE LIKE YOU/ ANIMAL ATTRACTION but it doe have a very soft or human side to it, that will appear perhaps to older audiences, meaning, those over 23 ...since the emphasis is on the various tone of human interaction, the small and introverted lifestyle that sometimes people have in large city neighborhoods. The key here, is showing people their human sides, and willingness to grow, help their neighbors, and life in peace with one another, responsibly. Clearly, these type of movies, showing nostalgia, mixed with urban living, realism, drama and responsibility in each moment, are not the norm, considering the "fantasy" or "unreal" story often chosen by Hollywood, that target the below 17 age bracket. Perhaps, at the end of the day, everyone will learn to enjoy this small urban tale featuring OUTSTANDING acting talent of William Hurt, and the legendary Harvey Keitel. As for Ashley Judd, an extremely versatile and one of my favorite actresses, she really doe a shocking role in this movie, playing a delinquent adolescent girl, not unlike the other movie, NORMAL LIFE. This is the old Judd that we used to see, in other movie of the same period, such a Ruby in Paradise, or the Passion of Darkly Noon, or a Time to Kill, or the Locusts, all great performance with Judd. The later movies, seem to show a Judd in a different phase of her life than before, but in SMOKE, Judd's 5 minute performance will surely grab your attention. text_final: I purchased this at Bed Bath and Beyond 15 month ago. It squeegee the glass very well, and the suction cup fixture stay up. (It detached just once, in the seasonal change from humid to dry weather.) No rust, and the rubber blade ha stayed flexible. The folding design keep the squeegee off to the side, out of sight. Yet, I'm unhappy: the folding pivot point ha loosened over these 15 months. If it wa just a bit "wiggly," that might be okay. However, the pivot and it fold-lock mechanism are obviously parting ways. The squeegee is no longer effective because the blade cannot be held perpendicular at the end of the swiveling handle. My experience with this squeegee is similar to other "simplehuman" product I've used in the past. They look well-designed, with an aesthetic similar to Oxo and other neo-design products. But, their engineering ha invariably incorporated flaw that eventually destroy the product's usefulness. I'll be replacing this squeegee with one from another manufacturer, and not purchasing from this line again.

text_final: I received my Black & Decker Allure Iron and quickly discovered sign that it had been returned. The cord wa not neatly wrapped. The tab on the box wa open. There were fingerprint on it. I plugged it in and found that it would only heat to about 130. Then a thin line of smoke came up from the iron. I returned it and Amazon promptly sent me a new one. With the wonderful review I've seen here I wa confident that the this one would work beautifully! Sadly this one wouldn't get hot enough either! It put out a good amount of steam but only heated again to about 130. I tried ironing a cotton garment and it just wouldn't get all of the wrinkle out! Let me assure you, I followed the instruction in the manual to the letter! The second one went back too. I got a quick refund. Despite the great review I just wasn't ready to try my luck on a third! Very disappointing! Update: I very much appreciated Spectrum Customer Service reaching out to me. I contacted them and they sent me a new iron. Sadly this iron performs about the same a the others. I checked the temperature of the soleplate when set on "linen". The temperature wa in the 130s in some areas, high 120 in others. My research show that an the temp should be about 235 on linen, 204 on cotton. 135 is good for nylon, acrylic , spandex. This iron put out good steam and will get mild wrinkle out of cotton (when set on linen) but won't remove a crease. It won't get linen completely smooth. This is 3 out of 3 Allure iron that won't get hot enough. I would encourage other reviewer to check their iron with an infrared thermometer and see what reading you get, especially if you purchased yours in the last few months.

text_final: This novel take a look at a mystery, a Judge who disappeared without a trace in 1930, in New York. It wa a case that garnered much attention at the time. The story is told from the viewpoint of Judge Crater's wife, mistress and household maid, all important woman at his life at the time of the disappearance. The historical accuracy seems to be there, although I wa disappointed that it wasn't shared in more detail. Prohibition, Tammany Hall, political corruption-so much going on then that could have added even more background to the story. The character of the woman in his life are wonderful, fully drawn and seeming true to life, and sometimes bigger than life. I wa enthralled by the story, and hated to see it end.

text_final: Was hoping to get a decent cup of coffee from this machine but wa disappointed. Major problem is that the water is not heated sufficiently when the coffee is brewed to deliver a hot cup of coffee when the brewing process stops. As cold tap water temperature are somewhat cooler out of the tap in the winter I tried slightly preheating the water before placing it in the coffeemaker...no major improvement. Temperature of coffee in pot immediately after being brewed about 145 degrees. What's interesting is that the coffee did indeed get hotter after sitting on the heating element than it wa after it initially brewed. Unfortunately, we like to drink coffee immediately after it ha been brewed not 30 minute or an hour later. Our old Braun coffee pot delivered much hotter coffee. A few minor point include the area where you pour water into the coffeemaker being a little smaller than expected,and the need to move the brew water delivery arm back and forth. This coffee maker wa bought a one of a few small thing that we put under our Christmas tree to give ourselves so the 30 day return period to Amazon ha past otherwise it would go back.

text_final: I bought this for my fianc, because we live in a bad area. Pros: -Much more natural to use/hold than a common can of pepper spray. -Well built, feel solid. It ha a thick screw in piece in the back (like a flashlight) where you can remove the propellant. -Detachable keychain is perfect. It take a good bit of force to detach, which is good. Cons: -Very short range. We bought a practice spray canister to try it out, and the spray only ha an effective range of about 5 feet. At the end of this 5 foot it ha turned into a cloud of mist, so any breeze will reduce the range even further or cause self harm by blowing it back in your face. But it is still effective a a last resort close range spray. -Button is easy to press. Moving it forward and down doe not take a much force a I expected, so it seems there is a risk of it going off accidentally in a purse or pocket, especially since the button is raised and can catch onto things. This ha not happened yet though. -Extremely limited capacity. the spray canister is TINY. You only get a few short spray out of this, or about a 3 second long spray. This could be a pro for some, a it le likely a bad guy can use it against you once you unload it. -As mentioned by others it look inappropriate from the top. Someone made some bad design choice on it appearance. While there may appear to be more con than pros, this serf it purpose a an easy to use, last resort, close range pepper spray. It feel very natural and is easy to aim/conceal. Its always ready if it on your keychain and can be detached if your key are in the ignition. I would recommend getting a practice canister to get used to how the button work and the aiming/effective range.

text_final: I rented this DVD only out of curiosity because I had heard of this often overlooked sci-fi entry made by Mario Bava. To be honest, given its' B-movie status, I wa expecting a rather one dimensional gore-fest. Nothing could be further from the truth. Even at this early point in his career, one can see how talented a director Bava is. Clearly shot on a low budget, like Roger Corman, Brava, by using some very clever camera approach and wonderfully creative set (its' quite obvious the maker of the Alien film used this along with other 1950s' B-movies a sources)constructs a film that is both intelligent and engaging. An interplanetary crew from Earth, answering a distress signal from another planet, land and get more than they bargained for. Very smart, underplayed and scary. At time I felt I wa watching an episode of a well done Star Trek entry. Very well done. Worth the rental.

text_final: I installed this msata in my Lenovo Ideapad Y580. Installation wa easy (thank you, Crucial, for including screw with this drive!) and the machine recognized the drive immediately. After a little work, I wa able to install Ubuntu on this drive and dual-boot between Linux and Windows 8.1. Booting into Linux is super fast, even compared to regular Linux boot times. For anyone else looking to do the dual-boot trick, the key is to use the most recent version of Ubuntu (the older version don't play well with the Windows UEFI boot loader) and make sure you disable the Secure Boot option in your BIOS. Also, turn off the Fast Startup in Windows 8 if you want to be able to access your Windows partition from Linux, otherwise Windows just hibernates instead of doing a complete shut down.

label: OR
text_final: INVENTING GEORGE WASHINGTON: AMERICA'S FOUNDER IN MYTH AND MEMORY is an interesting look into some of the many story we've all heard about George Washington. Edward Lengel's primary focus in this book isn't so much the myth themselves, but their place in American lore and, more importantly, the reason behind their origination. While we all know the "chopping down the cherry tree" story is whole-cloth fiction, you'd be surprised at some of the real source of George Washington quote and lore that Lengel exposes. While some were innocent enough embellishment upon actual event or wholly made-up fiction, the reason behind others are far from innocent. Whether used for the villification of Washington and the American Experiment OR to further the end of the idea that America is a "just cause," Lengel delf into the prevelance of the mythology in today world. Even after exhaustive publication of authenticated writing directly from the hand of George Washington, many of the myth retain their seeming veracity. Whether taken from forged writing of George Washington or from the imagination of biographers, admirer or detractors, you'd be surprised by the quoatation of these story in today modern era--usually to serve modern political ends. While Lengel seemed to make no conclusion a to what to do about this problem, it left this reader with one thought in mind: Before you tell any story--good or bad--or attribute any quotation to George Washington, make sure YOU do your own research and verify it sourcing. As to the legends? Maybe they DO serve a purpose and DO have a place in American society. If not for some of them, it might be kind of hard to inspire the American people and keep ol' G.W. "..first in the heart of his countrymen." I give this book FOUR STARS. Well worth the read if you have even a passing interest in discovering the REAL George Washington. Although, that will require additional careful research on your part, you'll at least have a new found suspicion for story and qoutes being bandied about today!

text_final: I have never read anything about this author before, and I have to say that I wa delighted with his work. I enjoyed this novel a lot, and it gave me a good glimpse of what life can be for a well-off older couple in modern Israel. How they cope with everyday life, family issues, death, mourning, separation, etc. It wa a slow read, but not boring at all. It all happens during an eight-day holiday; Hanukkah. And with the lighting of each candle we get to see how the past and present of this family unfolds. However, I would have liked to know more of some characters, like the couple's son and daughter, for example, or the grandfather, but you still get some hint a to what their life are like. You can pretty much put the puzzle together, or develop the character in your mind any way you want. After all the story revolves around the married couple, Daniela and Amotz, who by the way make a nice couple. The brother in law, Yirmiyahu, is so mysterious and obscure, that you get hooked with him trying to unravel his mind and feelings. Africa seems then the appropriate setting for this man, and all that surround him enhances the mystery. And he doe spice the book a lot. Overall, I think it's a good read, and an enjoyable book.

text_final: I mounted several projector before, and this mount is one of the poorest design. First, documentation wa almost non-existent. You will need to "fill in the gap", to figure out where all the screw go. Most of the time, I had to improvise and even use some nut and bolt from my own tool kit. Second, the mount did not fit Optoma HD131Xe. I played around with different configuration options, and finally had to bend one of the arms, and put some hole in another, just to make it fit. Third, the sliding arm design is very poor. There is very limited range of adjustment (15 degree according to the manual, but more like 10 degrees), and adjustment screw are very hard to reach. Most of the good design mount have full 360 horizontal turning ability, but not this one. Once you installed it, you are done.

text_final: Having watched RAI's Montalbano television series (with Luca Zingaretti's outstanding performance a the eccentric inspector), I wa expecting to find the novel familiar and boring. Not at all, not in the least. The TV series excel in giving u the visual feel of the exteriors: the superb cast of delightful characters; and the beauty of Camilleri's fictional town of "Vigta" in the fictional district of "Montelusa" (actually the Sicilian city of Ragusa, Italy, and surrounding towns). The novel give u what TV cannot, the interiors, the feeling and cogitation of the uniquely unpredictable Montalbano and the reaction of those around him. As Montalbano's faithful (and unusually astute) detective, Fazio, say to himself in "The Snack Thief," his bos didn't become insane, he wa insane from birth. The novel reinforce TV's visual charm and delicious performance with the "insides" of the plots, people, and places. In many ways, "Voice of the Violin" is the most noir of the series--plot and counter-plot turn the unraveling into a delicious concerto of criminality. One can hear the gear and the arpeggio whirling about in Salvo brain. Camilleri's novel are such a delight to read, I imagine Montalbano's police force colleagues, friend and lovers, even his opponent (criminal and bureaucratic), who lived the plot with him, would enjoy these books. And Montalbano? He'd read the novel and then ask Camilleri, half-serious, half-mocking, "So, why are you always busting my balls?"

text_final: I thoroughly enjoyed "Double Fudge". . . This book once again focus on the book's main character Farley Drexel Hatcher (B.K.A. "Fudge"). He is absolutely hilarious in this book. His obsession with money, his twin cousin and their little brother nicknamed "Mini", along with their parent are another interesting twist in this story. Peter Hatcher, Fudge's older brother, who is now an official "junior high school student", typically experience all of the anxiety that is associated with early adolesence. This book made me laugh and laugh, especially the reaction of Mr. Hatcher when he discovers that their his cousin want to stay at their house longer than a week. I wa also able to put myself in many of the situation and generally grasp a feel each of the characters. The first book that I ever read in the Fudge series wa "Tales of a Fourth Grade Nothing" followed by "Superfudge". I can remember attending Jefferson Elementary School in Little Rock, Arkansas waiting in line for what seemed like an infinity, to have first bid on checking out that book. I became a "reader beaver" thanks to Judy Blume and the wonderful staff at Jefferson Elementary who encouraged all student to build their foundation through reading. I used to walk swifly through the library with the rest of my classmate running straight towards the "B" fiction section --shouting, "Ready or not here I come." This is an excellent read, and it is author like Judy Blume who grasp the interest of young reader by making her work interesting and identifiable to young readers. Thank you Ms. Judy Blume for providing great reading material for child of all ages!

text_final: When I selected this Barbie doll and horse play set (based on the upcoming movie Barbie & Her Sisters in A Pony Tale) to try, I didn't realize it wa remote controlled (it appears to be the only Barbie horse so controlled so far), so this function came a a complete surprise, and once I figured out that it needed 4 AAA battery not 2 (mentioned on the box of course but surprisingly not obvious in the battery installation instructions), it functioned exactly a it wa supposed to. Controlled either by the Barbie doll remote control or by forehead button when Barbie is riding (though depending on the play area you might be able to bounce Barbie's arm activated infrared signal off the wall and make it work that way), the horse walks, stops, bows, and recovers from the bow a intended. In our experience the horse walking worked well on smooth flooring and thin carpeting, but not (obviously IMHO) on thick carpeting. Restarting the horse after it enters sleep mode is a little tedious (holding the button down until something happens) but better than the alternative of running the battery down. I can see some definite additional play possibility if and when they start making more of these remote control horses, especially if they speed them up a bit and add unicorn so that they can be made to ram into each other. (When I mentioned this to my 9-year-old daughter, she raised an eyebrow, folded her arms, and said, "Daddy....", then picked up the horse and stalked off.) Maybe it's another one of those difference between boy and girl things. Note: This play set is one way to (start) acquiring horse and doll for the otherwise horseless and doll-less Barbie and Her Sisters in a Pony Tale RV Vehicle, another remarkable toy in this line.

Okay, so maybe she isn't a typical NYC woman, but what she is is a fun character. In this sequel to Insatiable, reader are welcomed back into her life six month after the first novel ends. As the novel opens, reader see Meena a a serious agent for the Palatine. Her brother Jon is still trying to get a job with the Palatine. Alaric still want Meena. Lucien still want to make Meena his bride. And that's just the start of it. There is a rising vampire army hunting Meena; there is the Palatine hunting Lucien; and there is something "off" about the new member of the Palatine. With a fast-paced plot and quite a few twist and turn throughout, Cabot ha written an intriguing sequel. If you enjoyed Insatiable, you will not be disappointed with Overbite. On a final note, I just want to say how much I really enjoy Cabot's taking on vampirism. She is clever, funny, and satirical, making these some of my favorite Cabot novels. This is the reason I gave it 5 star instead of 4.

text_final: This is genuine adult fantasy at it finest. I don't mean it is pornographic, though there are sexual element presented within reason. What I mean is that Bakker doe not try to beat around the bush here. His character are flawed, in fact here perfection is defined a the ability to manipulate others. The most likable character are often the weak ones, but it is in fact this weakness that give them compassion for others. There are no definite good guys, even those seeking to battle against the apocalypse are suspect. After all, if you are fighting for such a worthy cause isn't any evil excusable? And if all men and woman are manipulated by their emotions, their past experiences, is it really a crime to use them or hurt them? Are they not machines? These are the question Bakker pose in the course of the novel, which is filled with political intrigue, military conquest, and realistic love stories. What I mean by realistic is that there are no virgin princesses, no knight in shining armor, but rather imperfect people loving each other. This is definitely one of the more honest fantasy that ha come down the pipe in quite some time.

The Life List by Lori Nelson Spielman is a study of a person's transformation from a life being led to a life worth leading. The journey, however, is not without it own set of trial and tribulations. When we meet Brett, the main character, she is the picture of success with the entire package of successful trappings: friends, love, professional achievement, and a life in the great city of Chicago. It is only when Brett's mother pass away from cancer that the layer begin to peel away and we see what's going on beneath the surface. To further exacerbate the situation, Brett is fired from her job by a sister-in-law who receives a promotion in the family business that had been promised to Brett. Through a series of events, it come to Brett's attention that it was, in fact, her mother who ha orchestrated some of the event Brett is being forced to deal with. The biggest and seemingly most undoable is for Brett to look back on a list of goal she made when she wa just 14 and a is stipulated by her mother's attorney, in order to receive the inheritance from her mother, she must complete ten of the item on the list immediately. Dealing with the list and some of the goal penned a a young girl seems, well, difficult and impossible (get a horse?) particularly since she is in a state of grief. Working through the list at first is challenging but watching her grow and evolve a she tackle each item, is miraculous, amidst surprise upon surprise but I will leave those surprise to be discovered by the reader. I really enjoyed this and am sure others will too. Recommend.

label: OR
text_final: For many year now, I've been a fan of the true crime genre; reading nothing but these nonfiction tale of the worst side of mankind. After a while, while still interested in the crimes, the forensics, and the inner working of the justice system, a reader can easily reach a point where the crime in and of itself ha no shock value. That wa not the case in my most recently read book: Pure Murder by Corey Mitchell. In Pure Murder, Mitchell tell the gut-wrenching, absolutely sickening tale surrounding the death of two Houston, Texas teenager girls: Jennifer Ertman and Elizabeth Pena. On what should have been a short walk home through on of Houston's city parks, these young girl had the bad fortune of meeting up with six of Texas' teenage lowlifes: Efrain Perez, Raul Villarreal, Peter Cantu, Joe Medellin, Venancio "Yuni" Medellin, Jr., and Sean O'Brien. Simply because the young, innocent girl were in the wrong place at the wrong time when these scumbags were "feeling their oats," they were tortured, raped, and murdered. For the first time in a while, this true crime piece managed to enrage me a I could not hardly fantom that in a group of six people there wa not one decent individual that could have, in some way, helped these young victims. And, a an added bonus, especially in a time where illegal immigration is such a hot topic, the attempt by Joe Medellin to use his illegal immigrant status a a mean to absolve the indictment against him was, to say the least, infuriating. He participates in the raping, mutilating and murder of two young girl and he expects that this country will allow him freedom on a technicality?! I could not even begin to understand the audacity of this pathetic, spineless child killer. If you're up for a good read that evokes so many emotion you feel a though you are on an emotional rollercoaster, look no further than this newest release from Corey Mitchell.

label: OR
text_final: Peggy Henderson's Blemished Brides series just keep getting better and better; In His Arms is my favourite by far. Levi and Grace have both had difficult thing to deal with in the past which have left them both reluctant to trust or let anyone get close to them. Thrown together in unusual circumstances, this is the story of two people who find their wall breaking down and that trust and love are possible. In my opinion this book contains Peggy's most beautiful writing to date. The character are realistic and well-drawn a always. Grace is a determined and stubborn person, despite (or maybe because of) the circumstance that have surrounded her life. She also ha a softness to her, and I wa on her side right from the beginning. Levi is a self-sufficient but thoroughly sweet and gentlemanly man. I wa also very much on his side from the beginning! Together they make the perfect couple, and seeing them happy at the end of the book wa extremely satisfying. The supporting character are great (I won't say more a I don't want to give anything away), and, a usual, the natural world, which Peggy describes so well, is very much in evidence. If I could I would give this book more than 5 stars.

text_final: Acorn Media ha provided the DVD with english subtitle which are helpful not only to people who have hearing impediment but to foreigner (specially when politician explain very quickly intricate schemes, with name of men we know nothing about). The story is very interesting from an historical point of view. It begin with Napoleon III being dismissed and end some time after the Second World War is over. Politics are not seen from Sirius, but through magnifying glasses: dayly and often cynical calculations, fight against political ennemies or so-called friends. Randolph's every day life is a sort of thrilling gambling. For instance, he resigns his charge, thinking the government will become aware it can't do without him; in case it doesn't Randolph will found a new Tory group, modern, kenner on social issues, and overcome the old Tory party. We see how time are changing: at the beginning of the story, upper class are extremely conservative, prjudiced with birth, wealth, morals, etc and at the end, one of Jennie's niece, an artist, go to Russia on her own to see what communism is like. Lady Churchill is a fascinating woman! Clever, brave, ambitious, free, quite different from the other woman of her time. With such "political beasts" a his father and mother were, we understand why Winston Churchill (remarkably played by Warren Clark) wa so outstanding a stateman. Love story don't lack in the movie; I found particularly moving the love affair between Jennie and the long-suffering Count Kinsky (embodied by the wonderful Jeremy Brett; if you like him, look at "posthumous Bafta for Jeremy Brett" on facebook).Though many tragic event occur (Randolph illness and demise, wars...), the dialogues, always brilliant, are often amusing: clever, cynical, sparkling with wit. People of the high society are depicted in a satirical way. Everything is beautiful: houses, costumes, music, actors: Lee Remick, Jeremy Brett...I find 361 minute were hardly enough.

text_final: Two Heart. One Hope. This series is so great! Melanie Dickerson's Fairy tale retelling story mix romance, history, and adventure together. The first book is The Healer's Apprentice. The adaption of Sleeping Beauty. Rose ha been appointed a a healer apprentice at Hagenheim Castle. A rare opportunity for a wood-cutters daughter like her. While she often feel uneasy at the sight of blood. Rose is determined to prove herself capable. Future will mean returning home to marry the aging bachelor her mother ha chosen for her a bloated, disgusting merchant who make Rose feel ill. When Lord Hamlin, the future duck, is injured, it is Rose who must tend to him. As she work to heal his wound, she begin to understand emotion shes never felt before and wonder if he feel the same. But falling in love is forbidden, a Lord Hamlin is betrothed to a mysterious young woman in hiding. As Roses life spin toward confusion. She must take the first step in a journey to discover her own destiny. Although Rose is not a courage a the other book heroines, shes more a bit old fashion compare to other character in other book(perhapsI guess only a little) Bur she ha her advantages, shes kind, she try her best to help her friends, and full of responsibility. She knew she cant be with Lord Hamlin because of the betrothed, so she decided to sacrificed her own happiness rather the good of Hagenheim. Besides all of that, shes a story teller!! How interesting! So for those who concern the shallow characters, I think it better to consider this book a a beautiful fairy tale rather than a contemporary novel. (the book itself is based on the Medieval term, sojust think read the book a Romeo and Juliet, but with happy ending. ) Forget the plot about a damsel in distress, youll find yourselves enjoyed a gorgeous romance story. This is post originally in my blog Vivian's Book Pavilion http://viviansbookpavilion. blogspot.

text_final: I bought this book on the strength of the review I read in Amazon, and all I can guess is that these reviewer are friend of the author because this is not a good book at all. My nine year old daughter and I read it together and she wa very upset by the constant ridiculing of Elsie, the fact that the author had to restate over and over again what a freak she was, a fat a a circus act, can't look at her feet, ha multiple chins, etc. Okay, we get it, she's fat! Now can we get on to the humanity of the child? The other girls, including the narrator, were unlikeable for so long that we almost didn't care when they started to realize Elsie wa a person with feelings. And my daughter wa very concerned with Elsie's mother's abuse of her, and very much hoping the mother would come to some kind of understanding of her daughter by the end. I read the last two chapter before she did, and when I told her that no such event occurred she refused to read the end of the book. As a writer myself, I wa disappointed by the author's lack of a grip on story structure. The character had very little arc, and there were no likeable character to relate to. In addition, the utterly terrifying chapter where the child are kidnapped by a truck driver and taken outside the city limit ha no place in a book like this. Nor did the slap on the wrist outcome by the police. My daughter also wa very confused by this. I respect the opinion of those who liked this book, but I couldn't disagree more.

text_final: In Love on my Mind, Chelsea is hired by Adam's company to help him get ready for their new product launch. If she doe well, there is a big promotion in store for her. She face two big obstacles...Adam is a genius, but socially awkward and she can't tell him she ha been hired to help him. This book is Ms. Livesay's debut with Avon Impulse and I think they have found a promising author. I definitely enjoyed this book. It's a sweet story about accepting those we love for who they are and seeing the potential in them. Chelsea and Adam were a cute couple. I loved Adam and his inability to lie. He is a genius with a form of Aspergers that make him very literal. It wa actually kind of refreshing and made him more vulnerable. Chelsea grew up in poverty and see her success a a way to prove she is better than her adolescent life. She ha some lesson to learn about what is really important. I would definitely recommend this one. It's a cute story and I look forward to more from this author, I hope Mike, Jonathon and Indi get their own stories! * I received a free copy from the publisher in exchange for an honest review.

text_final: I've recently moved my old C100 to the office (3 year old and no problems) and picked the Citiz for home. Overall, it's a great looking machine that simply make amazing espresso. Here's my quick note and comparison with the Essenza C100: - The red and black have subtle difference in the spout and capsule release handle. The black ha a chromed handle which make it look a bit more classier and a different spout shape which I ended up getting. The overall build quality look a bit nicer on the Citiz than the Essenza but I've only used it for almost two month so I can't comment on reliability but no problem yet. - The Citiz + milk ha a significant larger footprint than the compact c100. However, it doe integrate the frother using one plug which is a bonus. - The folding pedastal cup holder on the Citiz is great for my larger mug which I had to alway tilt and hold on the Essenza which wa a major annoyance. - The new Aerocinno is amazing ... a much better improvement over the older non-plus version and worth the extra money. The foam taste is a whole lot better a far a texture goes. The only thing is that it no longer us a clever magnetic lid to keep the extra attachment. - Overall, the Citiz amd Essenza are equally a good a the espresso taste great with both. I could recommend the Essenza for the cheaper price, in my case track proven reliability, a smaller footprint since the Aerocinno is separate and can be stored away. But for some reason, I'm just drawn to the look and "presence" of the Citiz. It's something that look subtly classy in the kitchen and make an easy process of making a cappuccino that much more enjoyable.

But he developed a very bad case of diarrhea. He stopped eating and drinking for a day. I wa so worried about the lil guy. After an overnight stay (& a very expensive vet bill), my lil bully returned home full of energy. The vet recommened that he would have to eat canned Purina EN for the rest of his life. Realizing that they really just wanted my money, I decided to switch his food. I decided to go with Canadae ALS. During the transition, BlackJack wa still having a loose stool. After more research, I finally decided on Cal Natural Lamb & Rice. I started mixing this food and BJ developed a very bad bloody diarrhea case. I started the "at home remedy" of pepto bismol and a bland diet. The pet store clerk recommended some canned pumpkin a well. BJ fasted for 24 hours. After feeding him boiled chicken & rice for a few days, the blood gradually disappeared. I slowly started mixing the Cal Natural Lamb & Rice. All i can say is BJ is feeling 100% better and his stool is solid!!! This wa the result I wanted with Wellness, but I wa very disappointed. IF YOU WANT A HEALTHY PET AND A FEW BUCKS SAVED FROM A VET VISIT, PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS FOOD!

So, I unpackaged the thing and prepped it before giving it to our daughter for Christmas. Comes with Ryder figure and ATV. The ATV is pretty sturdy and good on carpet. But, Ryder's leg are rather fragile. The Patroller trailer section only hold THREE (3) medium-sized vehicle while closed. BUT, you CAN stuff an entire set of Paw Patrol figurine inside the Paw Patroller when closed IF you use figurines, racer and/or an appropriate combination of figurine and mid-sized vehicles. The cab of the truck hold 4-5 figurines. (Five if you really pack 'em in, possibly plus 1-2 removable packs. ) Here's what we stuff in our Patroller (while still being able to close it): Two medium-sized vehicle with riding figure (Ryder & ATV, and Everest & snowmobile); Two small racer (Chase and Zuma); Two figurine plus their detachable pack (Skye and Rocky); Two figurine with spring-action pack (Robodog and Tracker); and Two figurine with other feature (Rubble and Marshall). Reasonably sturdy Paw Patroller. Makes noise. Comes with battery. Rather large. Opens to reveal a second floor. Not bad for transporting or storing all Paw Patrol figure / vehicle IF you plan ahead. Our daughter enjoyed it for Christmas.

text_final: I have my chain sharpened professionally when they begin to cut crooked due to uneven wear. Otherwise, I touch them myself a soon a they fail to cut uniform shavings. This usually occurs after about an hour of cutting hardwood or two hour of softwoods. If the bar get into the dirt or you hit a nail you will be sharpening even sooner. You can either carry several chain to get you through the day or be prepared to touch them up on the bar. I prefer to touch up my own chain because the saw shop usually take off about 2MM of steel when they sharpen. At that rate, a chain doe not last very long. If you touch up your own chain when they first begin to dull, you will only take off a few thousandth of an inch. This tool work well if you gauge the grinder off of the tooth a described in some of the other posts. The problem is powering the grinder while in the field. Cordless grinder don't hold a charge very long so you need to carry extra batteries. Corded grinder need a place to be plugged in. Either solution limit you mobility. I prefer the "Oregon" brand file and gauge. No electricity required and it easily go in your thigh pocket or field kit. Only one or two stroke per tooth needed for a touch-up and you are back to work. The gauge make it easy for even a neophyte to maintain proper tooth shape and depth.

text_final: Our son received this toy a a gift when he wa born. We were a little worried about putting toy in his crib, but soon got over that when we realized how well he reacted to Pooh and the music! Yes, it is a little loud for a lullaby toy, but the volume ha never seemed to bother him -- he sleep right through it. When he wa still in the infant stage, we used the remote control constantly to restart Pooh from the comfort of our bed if our son hadn't fallen asleep yet. It's great that the remote allows you to select your starting point: the toy come with three "stages" of songs, moving from singing to just music to soft music and bird chirps. We would replay the softest music when the baby wa nearly asleep, the singing when he wa still fussy and needed more distraction. He is one year old now, and he ha learned over time to turn it on and off (push the cloud on the pillow). We know he's awake when Pooh start singing! Quite often he hasn't quite had enough sleep, and he turn Pooh on, curl up with his blanket, and go back to sleep. The little light under the cloud is a great bonus, since it give the baby a little "comfort light" when Pooh start to sing (the light fade out a the music softens). Our son LOVES this toy -- we couldn't imagine bedtime without it! ONLY drawback (and it's negligible)--he love it SO much that we really go through the AA batteries! All thing considered, that's a pretty good "problem" to have. We highly recommend this toy.

I may have been too young at nine to read it on my own, but certainly it is a great read-aloud for child nine or a bit younger. At nine, I didn't understand all the fancies, but like the Wizard of Oz or Alice in Wonderland, this book succeeds on many levels. The Phantom Tollbooth encourages a child's love for language. It paint wonderful picture (with the help of Feiffer's charming line drawings). It is a perfect a thing a can be written. Oh, and if you're an adult without any child at home - buy the book for yourself. It will take you away from the Doldrums and into the Kingdom of Wisdom where your spirit can be renewed.

text_final: I heard the author in a workshop that he gave and it really whet my appetite to read the book and try out what he suggests. I have read countless book on dating, trying to figure out what I have been doing wrong, how/why I keeping picking/attracting the wrong partners, why there ha been so much resentment, conflict and bitterness in my past relationships, etc. After I read the book it all became crystal clear to me. I had been considering personality compatibility, but only in a general way. Neither my partner nor I were "bad" people, we were just the "wrong" people for each other. Dr. Avila's book enables you to "type" yourself, how to quickly size up others for their "type" and my favorite features, WHERE to meet others of your compatible type and HOW to attract and build relationship with them. These technique apply to BOTH opposite AND same sex friendships. Very targeted, specific information, very rare in dating books. I realize now that by following the advice in other dating books, I wa hanging out in the wrong place to meet MY best type. His theory sound rock solid both from a psychological and common sense point of view. I think that his book settle once and for all the opposite attract, but do they stay together debate. Lastly, I commend Dr. Avila for going beyond the theory, and putting the principle into practice by actually encouraging/helping set up LoveType social groups. In fact, I am going to his book signing tonight, to be followed by mingling and discussion of starting up a social group in the Los Angeles area. I'm REALLY looking forward to what might come of it! Feel free to contact me with question or comment .

text_final: I think this will catch me up on my book review over the last week... :-) For some recreational reading, I picked up Dale Brown's Plan Of Attack. This is one of those military war thriller involving the use of hi-tech weaponry to defeat the enemy. Overall, a pretty good read. In the latest episode of Patrick McLanahan's adventures, he's been demoted a rank for once again skirting a direct order given to him for defending a certain area by having and using some offensive weapon when they are attacked. He end up tucked away at a desk top with strict order to mind his own business and just do his job. But he end up getting intel that point to Russia preparation to launch a full-scale nuclear attack on the US. His direct superior won' t listen to what appears to be an outlandish conclusion, so he go over their head and end up facing a court martial. But of course, he's right and the attack take place. His small group of hi-tech commando are one of the few resource left to counter-attack, and he ha to once again disobey some order in order to make his plan happen. Since this book us character that have appeared in other Dale Brown novels, there is not a lot of background character development. If you haven't read the previous novels, you might be a little lost a to why McLanahan is viewed in such a negative light. The story move along at a decent pace, and the different weaponry is interesting to think about. While I didn't see it a a "can't put it down" book, I did enjoy the read.

The mystery in Paper Towns is clever, and will leave reader scratching their head a Q and his friend struggle to piece together the clue with some frustration and ton of humor. I know often it can be difficult for American writer to grasp the different cultural difference and language. Overall though it wa only tiny thing that unless you are from New Zealand, you wouldn't notice or pick up. These keep my leg warm in the winter and pair nicely with a boot. I have noticed that when something rub against them in the same place over and over, they can get little fuzz balls. They also attract animal hair like crazy. If you have pet you will probably become frustrated with this. However, I've noticed that this is common with ALL fleece legging so I am not removing a star for it - only letting other customer's know what to expect. Discounted sample tested for evaluation and review purposes.

text_final: Ignoring common sense and warning on the Web, I bought one of these hand held Dyson DC34 vacuum for about 4 time what I'd pay for a high end competitor's model (e.g. Black and Decker LiIon model). When I got it, I wa initially very pleased: Good suction, worked very well. The battery life is short (maybe 6-7 minute on a charge), but I knew that going in, and that's just part of the package. Then, after a number of months, the machine began stopping after a few seconds. It wasn't that the battery wasn't charged: I could use it for a few seconds, have it stop, play game with the unit, get it to run for maybe 20-30 second, have it stop, play more games, and so on to get the full 5-6 minute out of it. But the unit just failed to run continuously for more than a fraction of a minute. I went online and discovered this is a horribly common problem with this model. I contacted Dyson and had them tell me that the unit wa out of it (short) warranty and that I'd need to buy another one. That's not going to happen. Instead, I'll try to warn you all not to waste your money on this machine that, apparently, ha design defects. Instead, get a high end (LiION battery) Black & Decker, or similar model for a quarter of the price. It might not be 100% a good a a vacuum, but it's assuredly 90% a good, and in addition, you'll get a much longer lifetime out of it. And when it dies, you can buy another THREE before you're up to the cost of this piece of poorly designed junk. I wa burned. You don't have to be.

text_final: I wa interested in this book because of the uncommon setting of St. Louis--a city I love, but one that is definitely falling apart. That decay is beautifully described by Franzen. There's no doubt that the prose in 'The Twenty-Seventh City' nearly always sparkle and only occasionally fall flat, usually when he get too caught up in his philosophical meanderings inside the head of Martin Probst (who is quietly and slowly lovable). There are so many artful description and astute retellings of every-day occurrence to propel readers. Unfortunately, the interesting premise never expands much beyond it setup in the first 50 pages. S. Jammu and her comrade are interesting, but haughty, and their reason for taking on their twisted plot are never clarified beyond vague sketch of their activist and corrupted pasts. EVERYone in high society, apparently, enters into either physical or intellectual affairs, which often defy their characterisations, and there are so many character that are highlighted in their dull everyday routine just to service their importance in the book's ending that it drag down the beginning in middle. And when the climax of a 500-page novel hinge on the outcome of a referendum vote... well, I think that's all that need to be said about that. Still, Franzen's observation on our every day life and interaction are shocking in their familiarity, and he undeniably ha a good grip on many facet of how our society and culture functions. Twenty year after the fact his comment are still relevant. 'The Twenty-Seventh City' is worth reading, but only if read quickly; labouring over it and it blunted intricacy is not worth the time.

text_final: About me: I do not call my self a runner. When I run, I like to trail run. I typically do 3+ mile every weekend. I have done three Spartan race and am training for a Beast this month, so I've tapered up to 13.2 miles. I'm 46 and could still stand to drop about 20 lbs. 5,8" and 190 lbs. I have ran two Spartans in the Reebok All-Terrains, and loved them...except for the support. They are definitely minimalist shoes. That's exactly why I bought these. As much a I love the Reeboks for what they do well (grip, drain, etc.), my knee need more cushion. I did a ton of research and came to the conclusion that the Salomon Speedcross 3 ha the most cushion of any trail shoe. I've now ran in them on four separate occasions, and did my longest run ever in them. They will be my shoe for the Spartan Beast this month. My expectation is that they will do a well a my Reeboks, but with more support.

text_final: My doc ha been after me to use Hibiclens for a chronic skin problem I've been suffering with.. Problem wa I couldn't afford it. So being a rather resourceful person, I figured it out. If a Vet. grade product that is used on animal is safe, and it is the same basic chemical a Hibiclens (without all the dye and perfumes) then what the heck do I have to worry about? So I tried it, and it worked. But the real test came when I went back to my doc and told her that although I could not afford Hibiclens, I got a Vet. Grade product of chlorhexidine and used it. Her response? She smiled and gave me a thumb up! In other word folks, if this stuff is safe for Fluffy it's safe for you too. That is, a safe a any chemical might be. Use your head, read, dilute the stuff (one ounce per gallon). Don't get it in your ear and eye and please first mention it to your doc that you intend on doing this. They are the professionals, and if it's not good for you they will say so. Always check with your doc. And I don't mean Dr. Google.

text_final: These are neither a good nor a bad glove; you just need to understand what you're ordering. This is not a warm glove; it is a LINER, and a very thin, open weave liner at that. You can see your hand through the loose weave, so you wouldn't wear these for principal cold weather protection for your hands. They fit nicely and are comfortable with good finger length, and the biosensors work well on touch screens, although I don't understand why OR put biosensors only on the thumb and index finger instead of on all the finger tips. The glove is very flimsy and subject to pulls, runs, and catching on things, so I would not think them durable at all. They also have scratchy tag sewn into the inside at the wrists, which tag are annoying and look difficult to remove. Mine did not come with the clip shown in the photo (on Amazon) that hold the glove together when not in use. These glove made me think about which finger I use on my touchscreen, and I realized that I use more than just my thumb and forefinger (I regularly use my middle finger) so for me this glove doe not have enough biosensor tips. I'm not wholly down on the gloves, but they are obviously really flimsy and apparently not intended to be warm.

text_final: My one year-old son totally love his other Oball trucks, but I admit that I wa a little unsure about this one -- I really didn't think that he would figure out how it works, and I wasn't sure that it would be a "fun" a a dump truck or bulldozer. Well, I unpacked it from the frustrating packaging one night and left it on the floor, and the next morning he found it while I wa making breakfast. By the time I came over to see what he wa doing, he wa opening the side up and taking he car out, stacking other thing in there, closing it up again, and running the truck around. There's even a little ramp that come down the back for the car to come down from. The only downside for me on this one is that the design seems a little more finicky than most toy we use at this age. When you're closing either one of the side of the carrier or the ramp, their are bit on either end of it that need to snap in. To get both, you either need to realize that you need to push in on both edge of the ramp and on both end of the each of the flap down sides, or you need to apply pressure pretty exactly in the middle -- so with a young child, it's super common for just one end to snap in and the other end to still be unlatched, which in this house sometimes mean that the door flop back open when you hit a bump. It's not the end of the world, and I'm sure he'll figure it out a he get a bit older -- but it's occasionally frustrating for him now.
